1.title: Talkietive Tidbits: Kiran Manral on the writer's right to offend
1.plot: Bestselling author Kiran Manral, whose latest book Missing, Presumed Dead is garnering positive reviews, talks to #TalkietiveTidbits. In a rapid-fire round, she shares her thoughts about the position of women writers in India, E-books vs paper books and why it's important for writers to offend people.

2.title: Talkietive Tidbits: Acting guru Jeff Goldberg's true hacks to good acting and more
2.plot: Talkietive Tidbits : American acting coach Jeff Goldberg on the true hacks to good acting and why he believes that everyone can act.

3.title: Talkietive Tidbits: Comedienne Jamie Lever on her comic genes, channeling her inner Shakira and more
3.plot: Comedienne Jamie Lever on #TalkietiveTidbits tells us about inheriting father Johny Lever's comic genes, channeling her inner Shakira and why everybody needs a good laugh.

4.title: Talkietive Tidbits: Theatre artiste Ulka Mayur on folk tales, Bhakti poetry and why they are more relevant than ever in present times
4.plot: Theatre artiste Ulka Mayur on #TalkietiveTidbits talks about Bhakti poetry in modern times, adapting folktales into plays for children and and her other adventures.

5.title: Talkietive Tidbits: Dance guru Longinus Fernandes on iconic and inspirational choreographers, film stars and film-makers for choreography-newbies
5.plot: Singer-composer, Ankur Tewari, on Indie music gaining acceptance in movies, his new album- 'Duur' and why young musicians should think beyond using Indie music as a launchpad to a Bollywood career.

6.title: Talkietive Tidbits: Singer-composer Ankur Tewari on Indie music vs. Bollywood, how digital platforms have democratised music and his latest music project- Duur
6.plot: "All human beings need mythology to make sense of the world," says renowned mythologist Devdutt Pattanaik on Talkietive Tidbits. The author whose latest book 'Shyam' is creating a buzz, on why people confuse religion with mythology, making a bestseller and more.

7.title: Talkietive Tidbits: Mythologist Devdutt Pattanaik's gyan on history versus mythology, why people confuse religion with mythology and ingredients that make a bestseller.
7.plot:

8.title: Talkietive Tidbits: Critically-acclaimed playwright Ramu Ramanathan on Indian theatre and its invaluable contribution to India's culture
8.plot: "Theatre flourishes well when we have our backs to the wall," says critically-acclaimed playwright Ramu Ramanathan on Talkietive Tidbits. The award-winning theatre director sheds light on theatre as a minority art and its contribution to India's linguistic heritage.

9.title: Talkietive Tidbits: Indo-Jazz artist Rajeev Raja's insights into Jazz music's origins, influences and adaptability
9.plot: "If you take electronic music, a lot of inspiration actually comes from Jazz," says Jazz musician Rajeev Raja on Talkietive Tidbits. The founder of the Indo-Jazz band, Rajeev Raja Combine, gives insight into Jazz music in contemporary times and how Bollywood music composers like R D Burman and A.R. Rahman have been adapting Jazz according to the sensibilities of the Indian audience.

10.title: Talkietive Tidbits: Hindi novelist Divya Prakash Dubey on contemporary Hindi Literature in the times of English

11.title: Talkietive Tidbits: Satyajit Padhye on ventriloquism and puppetry as a medium of infotainment
11.plot: "Puppets can say more than a human being and it is less offending," says puppeteer Satyajit Padhye. The ventriloquist who was a finalist on the reality show, India's Got Talent (Season 1), sheds light on the art of puppetry and what makes it a great medium of satire as he talks about his father, Ramdas Padhye, from whom he has inherited this craft.
